intro: Solanum stenotomum subsp. goniocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often narrow and pointed, giving it its subspecies name. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
